channel.title: Activities on Omar Abid
channel.description: Recent content in Activities on Omar Abid

item.title: Next AI
item.description: NextAI 2018 is a Toronto based accelerator for early or idea stage AI-enabled startups. Made it to the finalist round among thousands of applications around the globe. Unfortunately, we were not shortlisted for proceeding into the next round. However, the connections and resources gained from the diverse set of individuals coming from a variety of different fields is indispensable.

item.title: Toronto Buskerfest Volunteer
item.description: NextAI 2018 is a Toronto based accelerator for early or idea stage AI-enabled startups. Made it to the finalist round among thousands of applications around the globe. item.title: Archangel Summit 2017 Volunteer
item.description: This summit is the annual gathering of mission-driven entrepreneurs, leaders, and professionals who want to do well by doing good. As a volunteer helping ticket holders find their way through the venue, I had the opportunity to connect with highly motivated individuals.

item.title: Startups
item.description: I have also been part of the following startups. Delivery From Mars. An on campus food deliver application that uses a peer-to-peer network to connect individuals wanting food and grabbing food. Includes a rewards program to incentivize users to recurrently use the application. Fix My Tech Now. Provide software and hardware repairs for laptops, desktops, Xbox, Xbox 360 and PS3. Bitcoin Arbitrage. Buy and sell bitcoins at a high profit margin.

item.title: Teaching Assistant and Tutoring
item.description: Teaching Assistant at York University EECS 1011 (September 2016 - December 2016) Computational thinking through Mechatronics. Invigilate and mark labs in addition to providing a tutorial at the beginning of each lab. EECS 1570 (January 2016 - April 2016) Introduction to Computing for Psychology. Invigilate and mark labs in addition to providing a tutorial at the beginning of each lab. EECS 3311 (January 2016 - August 2016) Software Design. Invigilate exams, tests and quizzes as well as aid in marking of assignments, projects and exams.

item.title: Research Assistant
item.description: Research Assistant at York University Active and Attentive Vision Lab Supervisor: John K. Tsotsos Description“: Addition of new features to TarzaNN â€“ a neural network simulator. Implemented in C++. Report can be found here. Electrophysiology Lab (October 2013 - April 2014) Supervisor: Roger Lewis Description“: Design and development of an electronic circuit for current-voltage measurements of Neurospora crassa hyphae. Report can be found here. Attention Learning Lab (April 2013 - August 2014) Supervisor: Thilo Womelsdorf Description“: Statistical EEG Data analysis of Macaque Monkeys for neural population decoding.
